subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph:
Novak Djokovic successfully defended his Dubai Championships title, beating Mikhail Youzhny, 7-5, 5-7, 6-3, in a rain-delayed final in the United Arab Emirates. Leading by 7-5, 2-0 before rain suspended play Saturday, the second-seeded Djokovic won his 17th career title. There were seven service breaks in Sunday’s 19 games.

¶Alisa Kleybanova won her first WTA Tour title at the Malaysian Open in Kuala Lumpur, beating top-seeded Elena Dementieva, 6-3, 6-2, in an all-Russian final. Kleybanova, ranked 29th in the world, dominated the seventh-ranked Dementieva, using her power and booming first serve to earn most of her points. kleybanova

¶Ernests Gulbis became the first player from Latvia to win an ATP Tour title when he upset second-seeded Ivo Karlovic, 6-2, 6-3, at the Delray Beach (Fla.) International Championships. Gulbis, who did not drop a set all week, was ranked 72nd but should move into the top 40 in the rankings this week.
